item.title: About Nilton
item.description:
Hi, I’m Nilton. Currently I am a 2nd year Biochemistry student at Queen Mary University of London

Education

Queen Mary University of London

BSc Biomedical Science (1st Year) 2023 - 2024

BSc Biochemistry with a Year in Industry (2nd - 4th Year) 2024 - 2027

Planned Dissertation in Ubiquitin Structural Biology

Predicted 1st Class

Work Experience

Stieglitz Lab, Blizzard Institute - Internship

  • Used computational methods, including AlphaFold and multiple sequence alignment tools, to predict protein-protein interactions.
  • Used molecular biology methods (including site-directed mutagenesis), bacterial protein expression and protein purification using affinity chromatography.

link text

St Joseph’s New Malden - Music Director

Volunteer Experience

Sythetic Biology and Biochemical Engineering Society - Structural Biology Lead

Queen Mary Opera Society - Music Director

Extra-Curricular Achievements

Marcou Academic Excellence Award - London International Model United Nation Foundation

Chairing Excellence Award - London Diplomacy Foundation

Best Legal Advocate -
